bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When running fairseq-generate, it failed to output BLEU score. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran):
Run cmd
<denchmark-code>CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0 fairseq-generate \ --path=$MODEL $DATA \ --task translation_multi_simple_epoch \ --encoder-langtok 'src' --decoder-langtok \ --gen-subset test \ -t $TGT -s $SRC \ --lang-dict "$lang_list" --lang-pairs "$lang_pairs" \ --bpe 'sentencepiece' --sentencepiece-model models/mbart.cc25/sentence.bpe.model \ --remove-bpe 'sentencepiece' \ --sacrebleu --fp16 --max-sentences 64 </denchmark-code>
See error
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/conda/bin/fairseq-generate", line 33, in <module> sys.exit(load_entry_point('fairseq', 'console_scripts', 'fairseq-generate')()) File "/workspace/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 281, in cli_main main(args) File "/workspace/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 38, in main return _main(args, sys.stdout) File "/workspace/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 272, in _main 'Generate {} with beam={}: {}'.format(args.gen_subset, args.beam, scorer.result_string()), File "/workspace/fairseq/fairseq/scoring/bleu.py", line 63, in result_string return self.sacrebleu.corpus_bleu(self.sys, [self.ref]).format() AttributeError: 'BLEU' object has no attribute 'format' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
It is expected that the BLEU score is printed at the end of fairseq-generate, as in previous versions of fairseq. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master, commit 4c55744 PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0) 1.5.0a0+8f84ded OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source Build command you used (if compiling from source): pip install --editable . Python version: 3.6.9 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1 GPU models and configuration: V100
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Ah, you're probably using an old version of sacrebleu. Please update with pip install --upgrade sacrebleu. We will merge a backward compatible fix soon.
